page.title: 12SIR ROBERT HART
page.content:
Sir Robert Hart often mentioned with fond memory his boyhood days in Culcavey and Ravarnette.
He was a great Methodist and founder of the first Chinese Brass Band. But his crowning sucess was that he founded the Chinese post Office and the Chinese Lighthouse System. His official job was the nspector General of the Chinese Maritime Customs.
He was also the first Pro Chancellor of Queens Unoversity, Belfast from 1909-1911. An article in the December 1985 Vol2 No.3 Queens Letter on Page 14 tells about the launch of the book. There is a picture of Lady Hilda Etain Hagart-Alexander and Lt. Col. Brodie Sir Robert's descendants along with the author and Sir Peter Froggart the Vice Chancellor of Queens
